result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert J Fessler was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 35 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Menomonee Falls Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to posters.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  
Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases.
Victim Impact Panel meeting was completed in 2014.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J Fessler in court, in custody, with attorney Jennifer Flynn.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Flynn makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 35 days)
  -18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases. 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____VIP was completed in 2014

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months

FINE :  $4513.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted, remainder to be refunded to poster)
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted, remainder to be refunded to poster- to be forwarded to Menomonee Falls Police Department);

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Dated 08/10/15, from Atty Flynn to Judge Carter, with attached documents for 08/11 sentecing hearing.
